page.title: 18Local History
page.content: Thornton Heath Pond was an oval pond encircled by railings and trams passed along to London. In 1950 the tram lines were removed. Now the pond no longer exists. Smog frequently clouded this area reducing visibility, making it impossible to see passing trams from the pavement. The Crystal Palace fire was visible as an orange glow and families found their window panes warm even at this distance from the conflagration. Viewing flying boats from the "Hercules Fleet" taking off and landing at Croydon Airport provided family Saturday outings. So too did the State and Pavilion cinemas. A Bingo Hall now occupies the State site. An interesting shop in the High Street called The Hole in the Wall had only a square opening, like a kiosk, through which purchases were made.
